name: Vienna Game
short_description: A flexible and aggressive alternative to 2.Nf3, often leading to f4 pawn storms and sharp tactical play.

name: King's Gambit
short_description: A romantic-era attacking opening where White sacrifices a pawn for rapid development and kingside initiative.

name: Scotch Game
short_description: An open and direct central confrontation leading to early piece activity and simplified structures.

name: Philidor Defense
short_description: A solid but somewhat passive defense aiming for a strong pawn center and counterplay later.

name: Petrov Defense (Russian Game)
short_description: A symmetrical and highly solid defense known for balanced and drawish tendencies at top level.

name: Evans Gambit
short_description: A sharp attacking gambit where White sacrifices a pawn for rapid development and initiative.

name: London System
short_description: A reliable and easy-to-learn setup focused on solid structure and gradual kingside pressure.

name: Slav Defense
short_description: A very solid defense supporting the d5 pawn while allowing active light-square bishop development.

name: Semi-Slav Defense
short_description: A highly complex and theoretical system combining Slav solidity with Queen's Gambit structures.

name: Benoni Defense
short_description: A dynamic and imbalanced defense where Black accepts a spatial disadvantage for active counterplay.

name: Benko Gambit
short_description: A long-term positional gambit where Black sacrifices a pawn for queenside pressure and open files.

name: Catalan Opening
short_description: A refined positional opening combining Queen’s Gambit structure with kingside fianchetto pressure.

name: Trompowsky Attack
short_description: An offbeat system where White immediately challenges the knight and aims for structural imbalances.

name: Bird's Opening
short_description: A flank opening aiming for kingside attacks, somewhat resembling a reversed Dutch Defense.

name: Réti Opening: Symmetrical Variation
short_description: A hypermodern opening emphasizing flexible development and indirect central control.

name: Sicilian Defense: Sveshnikov Variation
long_algebraic_notation: 1. e2-e4 c7-c5 2. Ng1-f3 Nb8-c6 3. d2-d4 c5xd4 4. Nf3xd4 Ng8-f6 5. Nb1-c3 e7-e5
short_description: A dynamic Sicilian line with central tension and structural imbalances around d5 and the weak d5 square.

name: French Defense: Tarrasch Variation
short_description: A classical anti-Winawer approach emphasizing solid development and flexible central play.

name: French Defense: Exchange Variation
short_description: A simplified French structure with symmetrical pawns but rich strategic maneuvering.

name: Caro-Kann Defense: Panov Attack
short_description: A dynamic IQP-oriented setup where White prioritizes activity and central initiative.

name: Queen's Gambit Declined: Exchange Variation
short_description: A strategic structure with minority-attack themes and long-term pawn-structure plans.

name: Italian Game: Two Knights Defense
long_algebraic_notation: 1. e2-e4 e7-e5 2. Ng1-f3 Nb8-c6 3. Bf1-c4 Ng8-f6
short_description: An active response to the Italian where Black develops quickly and invites tactical possibilities.
